title: A co-harmonic gyro-monotron with a novel corrugated interaction region
venue: IET Conference on High Power RF Technologies
location: Institution of Engineering and Technology, London, UK
description: This was the first academic poster presentation I ever gave at the 2009 IET High Power RF Technologies Seminar.

title: A co-harmonic gyro-oscillator with a novel interaction region
location: Pontifical University of St. Thomas Aquinas, Rome, Italy
description: This was the first international conference I ever attended - the 2009 International Vacuum Electronics Conference!

title: Recent progress on a co-harmonic gyrotron
location: National Science Seminar Complex, Bangalore, India
description: This talk focussed on efforts to contain the driving signal within the co-harmonic interaction region - 2011 International Vacuum Electronics Conference.

title: Modelling of magnetosphere-ionosphere coupling at Earth (and eventually, in the Jovian system)
venue: Uniting Planetary Models and Data Analysis Tools/Services: A Europlanet NA Workshop
location: Elite City Resort Hotel, Kalamata, Greece
description: This talk gave an overview of the Vlasov model, with a focus on the previous examination of the terrestrial magnetosphere; at the Uniting Planetary Models and Data Analysis Tools/Services: A Europlanet NA Workshop.

title: High efficiency klystron development for particle accelerators
venue: 58<sup>th</sup> ICFA Advanced Beam Dynamics Workshop on High Luminosity Circular e+e- Colliders (eeFACT'16)
description: This talk gave an overview of the work done by the HEIKA collaboration.

title: Numerical simulation of high efficiency multiple beam klystrons
description: This talk gave an introduction to early MBK simulations.

title: A novel co-harmonic gyrotron
venue: 2<sup>nd</sup> UK-EU-China Workshop on Millimetre Waves & Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT 2009)
location: Rutherford Appleton Laboratory, Didcot, United Kingdom
description: This talk discussed numerical results from MAGIC3-D of the single cavity co-harmonic gyrotron.

title: Components for the testing of a co-harmonic gyrotron
description: This poster gave an overview of the design and expected performance of components for testing the single cavity gyro-multiplier.

title: Recent results on the cold testing of a co-harmonic gyrotron
location: University of Strathclyde, Glasgow, United Kingdom
description: This talk presented the design, numerical and experimental results  for testing the single cavity gyro-multiplier.

title: Numerical simulations of novel gyro-multiplier schemes
venue: 4<sup>th</sup> UK-EU-China Workshop on Millimetre Waves & Terahertz Technologies (UCMMT 2011)
location: University of Strathclyde, Glasgow, United Kingdom
description: This talk gave an overview of numerical results from MAGIC3-D focussing on two distinct schemes of gyro-multiplier.

title: Numerical design of high efficiency klystrons using core oscillation bunching
location: University of Strathclyde, Glasgow, United Kingdom
description: This talk gave an overview of 800 MHz klystrons investigated by HEIKA.

title: Numerical simulation of high efficiency hollow beam klystrons
description: This talk gave an overview of numerical simulations focussing on hollow beam klystrons investigated by HEIKA.

title: Vlasov simulations of MI-coupling in the Jovian system
description: This poster gave an introduction to the 1-D Vlasov model used to examine field aligned currents in the Jovian magnetosphere.

title: Vlasov simulations of MI-coupling in the Jovian system
description: This talk discussed early results of the Vlasov model when applied to the Jovian magnetosphere.

title: 1-D hybrid kinetic/fluid modelling of the Jovian magnetosphere
description: This poster presented early results of the Vlasov model when applied to the Jovian magnetosphere.

title: Predicting field-aligned currents in the Jovian magnetosphere
description: This poster presented results from the Vlasov model and how these are used to inform FACs.

title: Predicting field-aligned currents and precipitating intensity profiles at Jupiter
description: This poster presented results from the Vlasov model and how these are used to inform FACs and particle precipitation profiles.

title: Modelling 1-D quasi-static potential structures at Jupiter
description: This talk discussed numerical results on the behaviour of quasi-static potential features in the Jovian magnetosphere.
